Description: Built to the exacting standards of legendary Gibson designer Ted McCarty, this 2001 PRS McCarty Rosewood is a gorgeous example of one of Paul Reed Smith's most enduring models. This beauty features a thick Mahogany back (an 1/8th inch thicker than other PRS models of the time), East coast maple top, wide-fat 22-fret neck, Abalone fret DOTS, stop-tail bridge, vintage-style tuners, McCarty Pickups and wiring, a push/pull coil-tap on the tone control, 3-way toggle pickup selector, and of course, the East Indian Rosewood Neck option.FeaturesYear: 2001Serial: 1 52453Weight: 7 lbs 14.6 ozModel: McCarty RosewoodColor: Cherry SunburstThicker Mahogany backEast Coast Maple topEast Indian Rosewood neckWide-Fat neck22-fretAbalone fret dotsStop tail bridgeVintage-style tunersMcCarty pickupsMcCarty wiringCoil tap on tone knob3-way pickup selectorOriginal case candy and hang tagsOriginal hardshell caseConditionExcellent Condition; very clean, with minimal wear from gentle use. There are a couple tiny dings in the lower bout, barely noticeable. No major damage or notable wear. Plays great, sounds terrific, and looks amazing. This is a pre-owned guitar and there may be signs of use. Please view the pictures carefully and consider them part of the description.
